definition: lit. belly full of complaints (idiom)/discontent/always moaning and complaining
full of political wisdom (idiom)/politically astute/with encyclopedic experience of state policy
full of wisdom (idiom); astute and widely experienced

sentences.english: But what if you’re feeling grouchy?
sentences.chinese: 如果你自己都满腹牢骚情况会怎么样呢？

sentences.english: She stared, colored, doubted, and was silent.
sentences.chinese: 她瞪着眼，红着脸，满腹狐疑，闭口不响。

sentences.english: "At the time, " he added, "I was really brassed off (angry) about it."
sentences.chinese: 他还说，“那个时候，我真是满腹怨气”。

sentences.english: For my dream i will grin and bear it, without complaint.
sentences.chinese: 为了这个梦想我要任劳任怨不再满腹牢骚。

sentences.english: So it was that a duplicitous Chancellor took advantage of this unswerving allegiance.
sentences.chinese: 这坚定不渝的忠诚也是满腹阴谋的议长所利用的优势。

sentences.english: I was racked with doubt and pain.
They often take an unusual path, thanks to their intellect and offbeat ideas.
sentences.chinese: 满腹的才华和非主流的思想常常使水瓶座不走寻常路。

sentences.english: You don't want to come across as a whiner.
sentences.chinese: 你也不愿意碰到一个牢骚满腹的人吧。

sentences.english: The March wind is fretful, fretting the languid waves into murmurs.
sentences.chinese: 三月风躁动不安，把倦怠的波浪搅得满腹怨言。

sentences.english: Timid people always wreak their peevishness on the gentle.
sentences.chinese: 怯懦的人总是把满腹牢骚向温和的人发泄。

sentences.english: They left that house confused and wondering, never to see Harold again.
sentences.chinese: 他们满腹狐疑的离开了，但是从此再也没见到霍华德。

sentences.english: He is extremely suspicious of all his neighbours.
sentences.chinese: 他对所有邻居都满腹狐疑。

sentences.english: you know what, douglas? you are a real boring whinger.
sentences.chinese: 道格拉斯你知道吗，你是一个牢骚满腹的家伙。

sentences.english: Thinopyrum drink river rat, but the full.
The Policeman hesitates, vacillates, then takes another rather uncertain step or two forward.
sentences.chinese: 警察犹豫了一下，满腹狐疑地又往前挪了一两步。

definition: one's whole heart/from the bottom of one's heart
to have one's heart filled with/(to collide) full on/(of farm animals) heavy with young
lit. belly full of complaints (idiom)/discontent/always moaning and complaining
full of political wisdom (idiom)/politically astute/with encyclopedic experience of state policy
hundred knots of worry in one's intestines (idiom); weighed down with anxiety
to have talent but no opportunity (idiom)/to be an unrecognized talent
